variation.description: XSLT08004 : priority - null case
XSLT08005 : priority - 0 case (span color green if 0 > -.5, red for failure)

XSLT08006 : priority
Author country: positive green, and negative red (.5)
Author last name: 1.222222222222222 green, 1.222222222222221 red

XSLT08007 : priority upper boundary cases, concatenates
Expected results: red on author country, red on author last name
XSLT08008 : priority contains text
XSLT08014 : priority contains text - hex notation
XSLT08112: default priority in attribute value template with x|y (bug 86835)
XSLT09103: Conflict Resultion - priority .0 versus -.0, expect document order to break the tie
XSLT09102: Conflict Resultion - priority 1 versus 1 expect document order to break the tie
XSLT09104: Conflict Resultion - default priority n versus default priority n expect document order to break the tie
Copy of 77783: XSLT09104: Conflict Resultion - default priority n versus default priority n expect document order to break the tie

XSLT09000 : priority
Author country: positive green, and negative red (.5)
Author last name: 0.499999999999999 (15 digits) red vs .5 green
XSLT08103 : pattern has the form processing-instruction(literal)
XSLT08104: Conflict Resultion - Pattern has the form NCName:* - should have default priority of -0.25
XSLT08101: Conflict Resultion - Pattern has the form Qname - should have default priority of 0
XSLT08102: Conflict Resultion - Pattern has the form @Qname - should have default priority of 0
XSLT08106: Conflict Resultion - specific match title[@style='foo'] - should have default priority of .5
XSLT08100: Conflict Resultion - * (and @*) with no namespace where stylesheet has a default namespace - default priority of - .5
XSLT08105: Conflict Resultion - pattern consists of just a NodeTest, just a processing-instruction, just a comment, just node()
XSLT08107: Conflict Resultion -muliple alternatives separated by | : two equivalent priorities - a|b
XSLT08110: Conflict Resultion -multiple alternates in a group : (a|a/b) a= 0, a/b = .5
XSLT08109: Conflict Resultion -muliple alternatives : split priorities - a|a/b specify a .25 c|c/d specify .6
XSLT08113: Conflict Resultion -multiple alternates in a group : (a|a/b) both take highest priority

XSLT08114: (Copy of 77878) Conflict Resultion -muliple alternatives : split priorities - a|a/b specify a .25 c|c/d specify .6
with 17 template rules
XSLT08108: muliple alternatives : a|b|a/b|c/d|c -three splits > 17 template rules
XSLT08111: mutliple alternatives including group: a|c/d|(a/b|b) > 17 template rules
XSLT09001: default priority -0.5 versus specified priority -1
XSLT09002: Conflict Resolution: the same template rule over 16 times, mixed in with other templates
XSLT09005: Conflict Resolution: over 16 template rules all named, equivalent matches use document order
XSLT09007: Conflict Resolution: include (xsl into default ns), literal results(with my: ns and exclude-result-prefixes) , inter-mixed priorities
XSLT09008: Conflict Resolution: include, literal results, inter-mixed priorities, equivalent matches use document order
XSLT09005: Conflict Resolution:over 16 template rules all wildcard, equivalent matches use document order
XSLT09010: Conflict Resolution:include literal result element, inter-mixed priorities with groups and |

XSLT09011: Conflict Resolution:include literal result element, inter-mixed priorities with groups and |,
document order breaks tie.
